summary: CD-971 refers to a Warren Commission document. The documents indicate a debate in 1968 regarding its declassification. Sir Charles Spry (ASIO) recommended against declassification, and Richard Helms, then Director of Central Intelligence, assured Spry that the document would not be declassified, citing the absence of public pressure. The document relates to an investigation of anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy before and after President Kennedy's assassination.
significance: CD-971 represents a Warren Commission document whose contents were considered sensitive enough to warrant a recommendation against declassification by ASIO, suggesting it contained information related to the JFK assassination that was deemed important to keep confidential. The specific content relates to anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy before and after the assassination.
